subject: Business
title: How Tax Brackets Actually Work
description: A quick, practical guide to How Tax Brackets Actually Work.

hook.text: Someone says 'If I earn more, I'll move to a higher bracket and take home less.' That's not how it works.

buildup.text: Tax brackets are marginal: each bracket only applies to income within that range, not your total income.

discovery.text: If the 22% bracket starts at $44K, only dollars above $44K are taxed at 22%. Everything below is taxed at lower rates.

twist.text: Your 'effective' tax rate is always lower than your top marginal rate. Most people pay far less than they think.

climax.text: Earning $1 more never results in taking home less. The marginal system ensures every additional dollar is net positive.

punchline.text: You're never punished for earning more. Each dollar is taxed on its own.

quiz.question: How do marginal tax brackets work?
options: Only income within each bracket is taxed at that bracket's rate
Your entire income is taxed at your highest bracket rate
Higher earners pay the same rate as lower earners
